intro: Aspilia mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's euphorbia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually reduced to small, scale-like structures, and it produces a milky sap that is toxic to some animals. Aspilia mildbraedii is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
